item.description:
It time for the monthly First Thursday at the Wadsworth Atheneum. Going to the Party, gets the movie for free. Movie is at 8:00 pm.

Phoenix Art After Hours provides a stimulating setting for mingling with friends after work. Sip a cocktail, enjoy music and other live performances, attend a gallery talk, and even see a classic movie or art film. The Wadsworth Atheneum is open until 8 pm the first Thursday of every month.

High Water Marks
See how the arts continue to be an agent of reconstruction in New Orleans in the exhibition opening of High Water Marks: Art & Renewal After Katrina presented by the Amistad Center for Art & Culture

Music
Experience an eclectic mix of deep New Orleans rhythm and sound with the Congo Square Ramblers featuring Richard McGhee

Hurricane Punch
(Free while supplies last from Hartford Distributors, Inc.)

Creole Cuisine
Food provided by Rajun' Cajun

Constructing Art
Gallery talk and community art project with exhibition artist Donald Boudreaux

Film 8 PM
The Bad Lieutenant: Port of Call - New Orleans (2009)
A drug- and gambling-addled detective in post-Katrina New Orleans investigates the murders of five Sengalese immigrants.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be floating around during the party and in the lobby downstairs prior to the movie.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: First Thursday and Movie The Bad Lieutenant (with Nicholas Cage)
